place_description:
Provided Coffee Uptown is a mini-cafe located inside of designer store, Street Commerce as well as a mobile coffee cart that serves an assortment of handcrafted espresso beverages and bottled drinks to the Greater Carolinas. We now have a second location opening in Concord on Oct. 6th, 2023!

Founded by two best friends at 18 years old, Provided aims to create an atmosphere of community wherever travelled. As coffee can act as a bridge of connection between others, the customer can expect "special experiences in unusual places."

reviews_data.review_text: Great espresso drinks. Friendly service. The place is small but I believe in supporting the small business. They do not serve any food here.

I'm puerto rican, we're known for our strong/amazing coffee. I've tried at least 12 different coffee shops with my mom, ordering iced and regular lattes as well as matcha lattes.. this by FAR takes the crown. The place is super small but very cozy with warm lighting and incredible decorations with artistic flair. The staff is super nice and welcoming. Their coffees and matchas are one of the best i've tried so far in Charlotte and their prices are budget friendly! I recommend 100/10.
Good coffee, nice small place - cozy
One of the best coffee shops in the city.

Provided coffee is THE hidden gem of charlottes coffee scene. I almost don't want to say such good things to avoid it becoming over populated but the owners clearly work hard and passionately to make good coffee.  Smooth consistent coffee with beautiful latte art! Also the matcha is genuinely impressively good! As an avid coffee and matcha drinker I'm confident this is 20/10 pls support
The barista was really kind and informative! Cute little place
Awesome little spot with a great vintage feel. Thoroughly enjoyed the latte and the service.

HIDDEN GEM! Such an amazing coffee spot, and Stephanie the barista was wonderful and friendly. The seasonal banana bread latte was delicious, and the spring espresso tonic was incredible! Highly recommend!
Best coffee in Charlotte.
Best cortado I ever had
Such tiny but cute coffee shop! The decor is fun and definitely curated by someone who was having fun making the space dynamic. The cortado I got was perfect and would definitely recommend!

20/10 recommend! We stopped by here a little after 8am and were the only ones there which was great. Our barista was super friendly and amazingly talented. I got the banana bread latte and my husband got a traditional macchiatto. Both were excellent. The latte art on mine was incredible with the perfect texture and the banana bread flavor was so accurate it was like drinking actual banana bread. She remade my husband's shot because she didn't like how the first one turned out and I was super impressed by that. Clearly a professional. I wouldn't hesitate to recommend Provided to anyone looking for great coffee and a great experience. Parking is easy and plentiful too!

Stephanie warmly greeted me as I walked into the space, elevating the already welcoming and relaxing environment Provided Coffee Uptown has created. When I asked her for a recommendation she amicably provided me one. I ultimately went for the chai, and it turned out to be just what I needed, with all of the ingredients I asked for. She was even so kind as to lend me a charger that I was missing for my MacBook during my time there (of nearly two hours). What the space lacks for in size it surely makes up for in ambience, music, product, and overall hospitality. I hope to be back soon. Great work!
Great coffee shop.   Legit espresso and cappuccino and more.  Great vibe here and super cool owner.  Nothing but love at this place.
Great coffee spot.  Very small inside but solid coffee and staff

Me and my husband happened to find this lil place on our way to the mountains. We both got americanos amd they where delicious! This place is small, and has a lovely atmosphere. I love that it's so tiny it encourages conversation. We really enjoyed it.
Very kind people. And DELICIOUS coffee.
cool spot, cool dude, good coffee/espresso

My husband and I stopped by this coffee shop yesterday and LOVED it! Simeon was our barista and they were more than willing to answer any questions I had. This may be a small coffee shop, but they do have a couch and two seats to sit down.

The atmosphere at this spot is unmatched and exactly what you would picture from a coffee shop. I eventually plan to own a coffee shop of my own and the vibe emulated exactly what I would look for out of my own business. The set up was also perfect for the size of their space with plenty of space to walk. They're also connected to a shop by a hallway on the left if you want to walk around afterwards!

If you're someone who wants many options, this would be a place you go to get out of your comfort zone! Their menu only consisted of two seasonal drinks and your typical standards like lattes, cappuccinos, etc.

We had the evergreen latte which is made with Juniper, Rosemary, Molasses and oat milk. The perfect drink to try for those that need something lactose free and still want a bit of sweetness to their coffee!

This is considered possibly the smallest coffeeshop in NC but they are not small on inventive drinks or amazingly friendly service. I suggest trying one of their seasonal drinks as they are nothing like the usual suspects you get from most coffee shops. They make their own syrups, so that have more room to play with flavors. There is a bistro set to sit outside during warmer months, but the cozy grandparents 60's/70s basement vibe inside is nostalgically inviting and cozy. Not a lot of seating but worth it.

Friendly barista however their iced latte was a bit milky and not enough coffee. Wasn't bad just felt like the ratios can be improved. Coffee shop is really aesthetically pleasing but only one couch so not a sitting down shop. Friendly atmosphere

lovely little (literally the smallest in NC!) coffee shop with a sweet, low-ego atmosphere. chatted with one of the co-founders and he recommended some great local spots for our CLT layover. places like this are my favorite part of traveling~
Their Mexican hot chocolate with expresso and Evergreen latte were must trys! So tasty, not too sweet - I definitely recommend
Great shop, had the Evergreen latte and really enjoyed it.
This was such a pleasant experience! They have a small friendly atmosphere that invites you in! J-Money even played us the guitar! His name is Jacob but deserves the name!
Amazing little spot here. Was pleasantly surprised. Met some great people in there! Coffee was superb!
Great coffee shop! Friendly staff. Check it out!
The tiniest coffee shop with a big personality.   Great coffee, hidden away in uptown, right off the UNCC campus.
Great place for a coffee
Good coffee, polite people, and very direct! Cozy spot, too. Definitely deserve the business!

The dirty chai latte will blast your face off and send you into orbit in the best possible way. There aren't chai lattes that taste so spicy and real anywhere else in Charlotte. On top of that- the vintage, rustic, yet modern decor with fun videos projected onto the wall to watch while waiting makes your time in the tiny space equally as delicious.

Don't overlook this adorable coffee shop owned by really kind individuals.
Love the decor!  Would like to bid on the Dale Earnhardt poster :)

Everything here was great, such a cute little spot. Coffee was incredible and so was the vibe definitely top 3 coffee spots in CLT. Not enough to deduct a star but they unfortunately don't have any pastry's or food. Coffee so good it makes up for it!
It is a very cute and cozy spot for coffee or their incredible hot chocolate for non coffee drinkers! Definitely recommend coming here for a wonderful drink!!
Iced latte was lit. Rain (not sure if I spelled that right lol), the barista was very personable!

If I were rating on service and vibes alone, easy 5/5. I forget my barista's name, but he was the nicest guy and we had a great conversation.

I had the Carrot Cake latte--and while I found it to be silky smooth and delightfully easy to drink--the flavor of the carrot cake syrup was just too subtle for me unfortunately. That disappointment was amplified by the $6 tag for what may've been a 10 oz cup.
Best coffee shop in Charlotte. Forrealsies.
Fantastic!
Owner is extremely friendly and knowledgeable when it comes to coffee. One of the best tasting coffees in Charlotte. Would recommend 10/10.
The barista is extremely friendly and welcoming! The coffee is also delicious and worth coming back every morning for!
I am not a coffee guy but Rain made me the best chia tea I have ever had. Would highly recommend this place for drinks or just to hang.

Found my favorite Indy CLT coffee shop! Small footprint with big personality. Preston is the man, made us feel right at home. The coffee was of course the best part, had a great iced chai and iced mocha. Easy to find, lots of parking, superb service and very clean. Will 100% be back!

Yes, the "espresso ahead" sign did it for me. I happened to be driving and saw the sign and if you're like me... well I had to stop by.

First of all, Stephanie was so welcoming and friendly. The coffee was a 10/10  also. I am excited to see this business grow!
Really cute place to work and get caffeinated! Great options but not many herbal teas. Just an FYI if anyone is looking for that. The service is very friendly and accommodating.
Small but mighty coffeeshop with friendly baristas making high quality espresso and matcha
Stunning coffeeshop! Barista was super nice and the cappuccino was excellent. 10/10!

i've never been to a coffee shop like provided, where you feel like you're sitting in the living room of the person who's making you a cup of coffee. The vibes are great, and the barista is very kind. it is a little bit hard to find, but just park in the parking lot, it's the last shop in the row of shops facing the street.

Not a coffee person, but WOW!

Great coffee, cool place, and great customer service. I don't know anything about coffee, but they (happily) worked with me to make a drink. Best coffee I've ever had! Really recommend.

If you were to ask me to describe Provided Cafe in one word, I would say "hey man or woman, stop your limitations on me. Limitations are the destroyer." This is exactly the same sentiment that Provided Kitchen stands by.

On my first visit there, i was expecting hipster-trash-heap, but instead was pleasantly surprised with upscale-professional-casual-stylish-trash-heap. Very chique. The open ceiling, water attractions, and smoking area make it a great spot to bring the kiddos. I heard from the CEO of Provided Provisions (we are close now) that they might be installing a TV solely dedicated to Wii Sports. I honestly don't know why other coffee shops in the area are not doing this? The coffee is the best bean juice that you can get from a can, times 100. It's not anything like the watery stuff from a can of garbanzos. Have you ever had fresh hummus? It's not like that either. It's different.

Provided Industries has given me new reason the scream at the mirror in the morning (in a good way). I've only been once, but once is enough. I will definitely be back. 4 stars.
high quality product, some goobers work there tho. beware. goober activity
Nicest workers who are willing to have a conversation with you, great vibes, and some of the best coffee in Charlotte!

one of the best places in charlotte! they have the best baristas, everyone is so kind and always doing their best coffee crafting. please do know it's a small specialty cafe, if there are a few people in line or you go with a group, drinks may take a minute longer than your starbucks run, but it is well worth the wait. every menu option and every product in provided is beyond high quality and they crush it every time. be kind to your baristas and go to provided!!!
Top pick for sure
Cozy lil coffee shop with the best vibes and people!

Truly one of the best micro cafes in the city. Their attention to detail as well as their passion for quality and consistency is unmatched. If y'all are looking for a new specialty coffee shop to try in Charlotte this is definitely worth checking out!

- My drink of choice is their Oatmilk cappuccino with a spot of mocha in it. 100/10 recommend!

This. This is the best place to get coffee in Charlotte. We have tried all of the other local coffee shops around uptown and this place has the best cup of coffee hands down. Very glad it's also in walking distance to the best park (First Ward) in uptown!

Love this place. Friendliest service. Fantastic drinks. Such a chill vibe. You won't regret this must-stop coffee shop. I find myself going out of my way - or holding out a few extra hours - to get my coffee from here.

I (F29) and my boyfriend of 5 years (M94) went to Provided Coffee on our anniversary. I was ready for him to propose as this is where we met. He told me to look nice and everything. As we entered the cafe, asked me to turn around. When he told me to look back he was gone. I burst out in tears as I ordered my Extra Large Hazelnut Caramel Iced Cappuccino Americano Frappe. The man that took my order was so nice to me, and being little heart-broken me, I fell for him. He saw the whole dilemma and he made my Extra Large Hazelnut Caramel Iced Cappuccino Americano Frappe on the house. He drew a little heart on my cup. He asked me to wait for his shift.

We are currently on our honeymoon in the Maldives. You are my heart, soul, and my morning cup of coffee. Live Laugh Love, Brian (M34).

edit- if i actually lived near here i would come straight to here, you guys seem so nice
Great little coffee shop on the corner of E 9th & N Brevard St.
Awesome and quaint third wave coffee spot. Highly recommend!

Provided Coffee is an exceptional coffee shop that I would highly recommend to anyone looking for a great cup of coffee in a warm and welcoming atmosphere. From the moment you step inside, you are greeted with the aroma of freshly roasted coffee and the friendly smile of the staff.

The menu at Provided Coffee is extensive, featuring a wide range of coffee drinks and teas to satisfy any taste buds.
My favorite coffee shop in Charlotte. Owned by amazing people and the espresso never disappoints.
Cute spot, coffee is great too. Their Friday night music was chill too. Owners are passionate
Literally, the best apple juice I've ever had in my entire life.

Nestled in an unassuming shell of a building on an unassuming corner in the north eastern corridor of uptown Charlotte exists an enfantile coffee project. Started by two childhood best friends, Provided Coffee is the newest, best kept secret in Charlotte. If you've never experienced a Provided Coffee Cart event then you've never experienced the best coffee that Charlotte has to offer from the kindest young men to ever do it. Their new storefront space is carefully adorned with thriving plant life and touches of authentic vintage memorabilia. An eclectic blend of mid century modern and late 80's art deco sensibilities, Cohen Malz and Preston Rollins (the 20 year old co-owners) have poured their experiences and preferences and musical tastes and vivid love for living into a space that's thrilling to the senses while comforting to the soul. A reinvigorating steroid shot into the whimsical sense of childlike wonder that lives in all of us. All in a coffee shop.
And you'd better get there soon because the secret's gettin out.
